intro: Piptatherum munroi var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered muhly, is a grass species native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its fine, silver-green foliage and produces small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It is a perennial grass that thrives in full sun and is often found in disturbed or arid environments. Its low-growing habit and drought tolerance make it an important component of native plant communities.
